meanings.definition: A person who holds a second job in addition to their main employment.
meanings.sent1: The moonlighters at the factory work late into the night to make ends meet.
meanings.sent2: Many moonlighters in the city drive for ride-sharing services after their regular work hours.
meanings.sent3: The moonlighters at the bakery make the best pastries in town during their extra shifts.
meanings.sent4: The group of moonlighters in the office shine bright with their dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent5: The moonlighters in the restaurant kitchen create delicious dishes while juggling multiple jobs.

meanings.definition: To work a second job in addition to one's main employment.
meanings.sent1: She moonlighters as a tutor on weekends to earn extra money for her family.
meanings.sent2: He moonlighters as a delivery driver in the evenings to save up for a vacation.
meanings.sent3: The cat moonlighters as a detective at night, solving mysteries in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky moonlighters as beacons of hope in the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight moonlighters as a guide through the forest, illuminating the path ahead.
